intro: Phanera stipularis var. brachystylus, commonly known as the short-styled phanera, is a species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small, deciduous tree characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clustered, fragrant flowers. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is known for its unique floral structure, which includes cyathia, typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
